verses.text: A Song \add or\add* Psalm of David. O God, my heart is fixed; I will sing and give praise, even with my glory.
Awake, psaltery and harp: I \add myself\add* will awake early.
I will praise thee, O LORD, among the people: and I will sing praises to thee among the nations.
For thy mercy \add is\add* great above the heavens: and thy truth \add reacheth\add* to the clouds.
Be thou exalted, O God, above the heavens: and thy glory above all the earth;
That thy beloved may be delivered: save \add with\add* thy right hand, and answer me.
God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and measure out the valley of Succoth.
Gilead \add is\add* mine; Manasseh \add is\add* mine; Ephraim also \add is\add* the strength of my head; Judah \add is\add* my lawgiver;
Moab \add is\add* my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe; over Philistia will I triumph.
Who will bring me into the strong city: who will lead me into Edom?
\add Wilt\add* not \add thou\add* , O God, \add who\add* hast cast us off? and wilt not thou, O God, go forth with our armies?
Give us help from trouble: for vain \add is\add* the help of man.
Through God we shall do valiantly: for he will tread down our enemies.
